title: 114_hr4054
content: The "Ensuring Quality Education for Veterans Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes a revision of the 90-10 rule. The "Ensuring Quality Education for Veterans Act" includes a revision of the 90-10 rule in the Higher Education Act of 1965. The revision allows for veterans' education benefits to be included in the calculation, and requires notification to the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs when a proprietary institution of higher education becomes ineligible or regains eligibility. The amendment defines veterans' education benefits and includes them in the calculation for the 90-10 rule in the Higher Education Act of 1965. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to include Non-Veterans' Education Benefits in the heading of subsection (d) of section 487. Certain proprietary institutions of higher education are ineligible to participate in Department of Defense or Department of Veterans Affairs programs of educational assistance. Certain proprietary institutions of higher education deemed ineligible by the Secretary of Education are also barred from participating in Department of Defense programs of educational assistance. The Secretary of Defense must ensure that no educational assistance is used for education at these institutions during their period of ineligibility. The institution is ineligible for participation in programs authorized by the Higher Education Act of 1965 for a specified period. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the relevant title. The text discusses the ineligibility of certain proprietary institutions of higher education to participate in Department of Defense and Department of Veterans Affairs programs of educational assistance. This ineligibility is based on a notice from the Secretary of Education under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs ensures that educational assistance cannot be used at ineligible institutions for the period they remain ineligible for Title IV programs. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the Higher Education Act of 1965. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by this Act shall be effective July 1, 2016.
